Sentencas: The Ce1-xGdxO2-delta (CGO) interlayer is a common reaction barrier layer employed in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs), to prevent chemical reactions between the (La1-xSrx)(Co1-yFey)O3-delta (LSCF) cathode and the Y2O3-stabilized ZrO2 (YSZ) electrolyte.
Titulo: Numerical Simulation of the SrZrO3 Formation in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, even with the existence of the CGO layer, formation of SrZrO3 (SZO) insulating phase can still take place, causing cell degradation.
Titulo: Numerical Simulation of the SrZrO3 Formation in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Considering there have already been a large amount of experimental investigations conducted on the above degradation phenomenon, the current work is attempting to numerically model the process.
Titulo: Numerical Simulation of the SrZrO3 Formation in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: A simplified numerical model of SZO formation at the YSZ-CGO interface is constructed.
Titulo: Numerical Simulation of the SrZrO3 Formation in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Based on the thermodynamic information and diffusion kinetics of the YSZ-CGO-LSCF system from the literature, the interdiffusion between YSZ and CGO, the Sr diffusion through the CGO layer, and the formation of SZO at the YSZ-CGO interface are modelled, reproducing the experimental data well.
Titulo: Numerical Simulation of the SrZrO3 Formation in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Limitations of the current modeling work are further discussed.
Titulo: Numerical Simulation of the SrZrO3 Formation in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
